pullRequest.body:
These are mostly transferred directly, except for `continuousAt_logb_iff` which needs different handling since it's not always true.

---

if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

### PR summary [fee5a61f07](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18621/commits/fee5a61f076ee90f803ad8093eb71bfa411fbdda)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ _root_.Finsupp.logb_prod`
`+ continuousAt_logb`
`+ continuousAt_logb_iff`
`+ continuousOn_logb`
`+ continuous_logb`
`+ continuous_logb'`
`+ logb_nat_eq_sum_factorization`
`+ tendsto_logb_nhdsWithin_zero`
`+ tendsto_logb_nhdsWithin_zero_of_base_lt_one`
`+ tendsto_logb_nhdsWithin_zero_right`
`+ tendsto_logb_nhdsWithin_zero_right_of_base_lt_one`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

```suggestion
theorem logb_pow (b x : ) (k : ) : logb b (x ^ k) = k * logb b x := by
```

Do you really want this as a `continuity` lemma? I would suggest marking it `fun_prop` instead, but I don't see that as being particularly useful either. I simply suspect that this is never going to be useful as a continuity lemma. 
```suggestion
```

If you write this in compositional form this would be a nice `fun_prop` lemma. That is:
```lean
theorem ContinuousAt.logb {f :   } {x : } (hf : ContinuousAt f x) (hx : f x  0) :
    ContinuousAt (fun y  logb b (f y)) x :=
  sorry
```
Of course, this probably also applies to `continuousAt_log`

This is one of the lemmas I haven't transferred yet in this PR, it'll be in the next PR in this series. `ContinuousAt.log` exists, and is a `fun_prop` lemma, but for ease of review I decided to separate it out.

As I argue above, I suspect this is not useful (but I'm happy to be proven wrong).
```suggestion
```
I didn't check. What's still missing?

Could you clarify your question? The remaining lemmas can be found in the referenced file; I have only changed this comment to follow the file rename. Would you like me to list all of the missing lemmas?

```suggestion
-- TODO add other limits and continuous API lemmas analogous to those in Log/Basic.lean
```

pullRequest.title: chore(SpecialFunctions/Log): transfer results from log to logb
